segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring onto the floor, forming a puddle, and she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the water, but she’s just focused on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long this has been happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to something, but she’s completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone should tell her before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is climbing on that wobbly stool, and it looks like it’s about to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole situation is a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything seems on the outside while chaos brews inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to this mess.
segments.speaker: PAR
